intro: Cota anatolica, commonly known as Anatolian cota, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Cota anatolica is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
